entry.title: A Simple Go http Server
entry.content:
Golang Rules!!!!! I recently have started researching this language to create a rest API that I can use with applications I will be creating. Before jumping into directly creating the rest API, I wanted to make sure I learn all the details on how the net/http package works. I will be building this application slowly so it will be spanning multiple post.

I created a simple http server that prints a message when its running. For example, if the http server is listening on localhost:8080 and you visit it with the following url - localhost:8080/linef then it will serve a page with the following text: ‘Hi there, I love linef!’.

The code to the application is as follows:
entry.summary: Golang Rules!!!!! I recently have started researching this language to create a rest API that I can use with applications I will be creating. Before jumping into directly creating the rest API, I wanted to make sure I learn all the details on how the net/http package works. I will be building this application slowly so it will be spanning multiple post.

entry.title: An app a day! Also...My First Blog!
entry.content:
Starting today I will be writing an application a day and highlighting it here on my blog. Since this is a new endeavor for me the applications will most likely be simple. Nothing too complex, just small applications that either solve a problem or I found that would be interesting writing. The application language will vary as I will be exploring different languages on my path to become a more proficient polyglot developer. Here and there I will be throwing a little bit of personal blog post about my life to keeps things interesting.

I hope you enjoy the daily reads!
